questionTitle: Which of the following organization supports the development of standards for cloud computing?
questionExplanation: OCC is comprised of several universities and interested companies.

questionOption1: MapReduce is Google’s patented software framework that supports distributed large data sets organized by the Google File System
questionOption2: MapReduce is Yahoo’s patented software framework that supports distributed large data sets organized by the Yahoo File System
questionOption3: The Apache Hadoop open-source system is based on MapReduce and GFS
questionExplanation: MapReduce is a programming model and an associated implementation for processing and generating large data sets with a parallel, distributed algorithm on a cluster.

questionTitle: Which of the following function is provided by OCC working group?
questionOption1: Develop benchmarks for measuring cloud computing performance
questionOption2: Provide testbeds that vendors can use to test their applications
questionOption3: Support the development of open-source reference implementations for cloud computing
questionExplanation: The Working Group on Standards and Interoperability For Large Data Clouds extends the architecture for data storage with a distributed file system.

questionTitle: OCC supports the management of cloud computing infrastructure for scientific research as part of the ________ working group initiative.
questionExplanation: OSCDP stands for Open Science Data Cloud.

questionOption1: SOA offers an architectural blueprint for accessing diverse optimized services through a loosely coupled standardized method
questionOption2: OCC does not support the development of open-source reference implementations for cloud computing
questionOption3: SOA offers an architectural blueprint for accessing diverse optimized services through a tightly coupled standardized method
questionExplanation: SOA is loosely coupled because the service is separated from the messaging.

questionTitle: Which of the following is single-purpose application implemented in the cloud?
questionExplanation: Applications of those types have less of a need for the flexibility and loose coupling that SOA provides.

questionTitle: Which of the following is used to describe Web services that allow for user input and modification?
questionExplanation: Web 2.0 is an acronym coined by Tim O’Reilly.

questionTitle: A _____ is the combination of data from two or more sources that creates a unique service.
questionExplanation: The layers added to Google maps are examples of mashups.

questionTitle: Which of the following correctly describes group of technologies that leverage HTML and CSS for styling?
questionExplanation: AJAX is a set of development tools that allow for client input into Web applications.

questionTitle: AJAX uses _________ for asynchronous communication between various data sources.
questionExplanation: AJAX stands for Asynchronous JavaScipt and XML.
